text:
Hey!
What would be the best way to update a contact property though some action on a website page? Let's say i create a button and want to create/update a property "clicked" to HubSpot. Much like a form submission but completely custom.

Should i make an api call though javascript or what is the approach?
I want to make this client side as form submissions.

Any suggestions?
Cheers
Hello. Is there a way do find the contact attribuied to the flux when  a form is send?
Hi there, I'm looking for an API to get form submissions for a contact, like form title, the time stamp of the form submission. Does anyone know which API I can use? Thanks in advance!!!

Trying my hand at APIs for the first time ever. My goal is to populate rows from a google sheet into rows of a HubDB table. I am using Make (formerly Integromat) and I think I’ve set it up 95% correctly, but still getting this error when i try to run it:

```{"status":"error","message":"Authentication credentials not found. This API supports both API Key and OAuth 2.0 authentication and you can find more details at <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/auth/oauth-overview>","correlationId":"*","category":"INVALID_AUTHENTICATION"}```
“*” was not part of the original error, but in case that ID is somehow for security, i’ve removed it.
looks like the language has been updated :grin:
Yes it has, I wonder what prompted that? :wink:
Hopefully we can get some working examples.  I understand that Beta means breaking changes may happen.
Hi Mark, if you are using Integromat's http requests I can give you a hand, I have set tons of those. Your API key must be misplaced or doesn't have the exact name it needs to have.

Hi Felix, not an expert here but maybe you can set something like when the button is clicked, trigger an API call to log a custom behavioral event, or even a note if it works, or update a property. You need to make sure that the contact is identified, for that you can use the visitor identification API or internal processes to send the webhook with the right contact info.
it searches by IDs by default, you dont need to specify the property ID just remove it from the request
I'm not aware of any, and if there isnt any, you could store the information in 2 properties and then get historical data from them, and match dates with titles using their positions.
I wish we could at least do that, or have them put the table in the website :smile:
yup true, because it takes time
Can we get *all* list of *contact* in *v3* version ?
